intro: Scholtzia thinicola, commonly known as the slender scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to California, USA. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, preferring full sun exposure. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, showy blooms during the spring and summer months. Scholtzia thinicola is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments.
